thread.title: She doesn't even flinch! The 'Scorpion Queen' who covers her body every day with the deadly creatures in bizarre zoo show
thread.title_full: She doesn't even flinch! The 'Scorpion Queen' who covers her body every day with the deadly creatures in bizarre zoo show | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Pemberton For Mailonline
title: She doesn't even flinch! The 'Scorpion Queen' who covers her body every day with the deadly creatures in bizarre zoo show
text:
View
comments
This is definitely not a job for the feint-hearted, but for one Thai woman covering her body in deadly scorpions every day is a way of life.
Officially known as the Scorpion Queen, the brave female wows tourists with her bizarre show of bravery at the Tiger Zoo in tourist hotspot Pattaya.
Each day she walks around the park interacting with tourists covered in the poisonous creatures.
It's not a job for the feint-hearted, but a Thai woman known officially the Scorpion Queen - covering her body daily in the deadly critters
The woman wows tourists with her bizarre show of bravery at the Tiger Zoo in tourist hotspot Pattaya, Thailand
Video footage filmed by one surprised visitor shows her placing the pincered animals all over her, and tourists, bodies without even flinching.
The woman, whose name is not known, happily chats as they crawl all over her, with amazed tourists flocking to take selfies and pictures with her.
 Grumpy Cat is not waxing lyrical AT ALL about being the... State on a plane: Plates and cutlery are scattered in the... Petal power: Portuguese city is transformed by breathtaking... Sick of the British summer? Then sail away with these... Ian Maclean, who visited the amusement park in Thailand where she works, said: 'She loves to entertain and scare the tourists with her antics.
'You can easily recognise her - she is the one covered head to toe in live, deadly scorpions.
'I wouldn't recommend it for the feint of heart.'
Each day she walks around the park interacting with tourists covered in the poisonous scorpions
Video footage filmed by one surprised visitor shows her placing the pincered animals all over her - and tourists - bodies without even flinching. The woman - whose name is not known - happily chats as they crawl all over her, with amazed tourists flocking to take selfies and pictures with her
She isn't the only one to get up close and personal to the poisonous creatures,
In 2008, a Thai woman set a world record for holding one of the deadly creatures in her mouth for just over two minutes.
Kanchana Kaetkaew achieved the record in a mall in Pattaya, a city on the Gulf of Thailand known for its nightlife and cabaret.
12 EYES AND A DEADLY VENOM THAT TURNS INSIDES OF PREY INTO LIQUID Deadly: There are 40 species of scorpions that are poisonous enough to kill a human
There are almost 2000 species of scorpion, and around 40 are poisonous enough to kill a human.
They feast on anything from insects to mice, but can survive for up to a year without food or water.
Despite having up to 12 eyes, scorpions have poor vision and rely on smell to detect their prey.
Scientists are still unsure why scorpions give off a bright green glow when they are under UV light.
The animals use venom to turn the insides of their prey into liquid as they are unable to eat solids.
